intro: Gelonium congoense, commonly known as Congo gelonium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Gelonium congoense thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth of rainforests.
